title: AFL Canberra
text:
AFL Canberra is the governing body for <a href="Australian%20rules%20football">Australian rules football</a> in the <a href="Australian%20Capital%20Territory">Australian Capital Territory</a> and the <a href="Southern%20Tablelands">Southern Tablelands</a> of New South Wales.
In November 2010 the five AFL Canberra Premier Division clubs merged with the Premier Division clubs of the <a href="Queensland%20Australian%20Football%20League">Queensland Australian Football League</a> to form the <a href="North%20East%20Australian%20Football%20League">North East Australian Football League</a>. From 2011 onwards, the AFL Canberra Premier Division together with the reserve sides from the <a href="Sydney%20Swans">Sydney Swans</a> and <a href="Greater%20Western%20Sydney%20Giants">Greater Western Sydney Giants</a> will form the NEAFL Eastern Conference.
Today AFL Canberra acts as an umbrella to several competitions beneath it. These competitions are Seniors First Grade, Seniors Second Grade and a Rising Stars League. There is also a women's league.
History.
The Canberra Australian Football League was founded in 1924. 
AFL Canberra was once a very popular local league, however since the introduction of the Swans and matches featuring AFL clubs being played at <a href="Manuka%20Oval">Manuka Oval</a>, the league's home ground, and the growth of local <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="association%20football">association football</a> competitions, AFL Canberra has experienced the loss of clubs and spectator support.
Names.
The AFL Canberra has been through a number of forms.
